author: chris2_2_2
content: Are eth pools generally allowed to decide gas limit for blocks or are we supposed to follow something? Someone showed me the whole EGL token Twitter thing and comments from devs and it went against what I had believed previous was that ETH promotes decentralized consensus aka pools are allowed to decide whatever they want.

author: fredrik
content:
By design, Miners/Pools can make their own decisions as to what target for gas limit they want to set, and after London it is most common to set it up to 30mm.

Worth noting though is that EIP-1559 targets ~50% full blocks, so miners who had the target set to 15mm prior to London would have needed to set 30mm to maintain the same amount of transactions per block, on average, after London. 

According to stats, it appears most Miners/Pools tend to target 30mm these days, and the utilization can indeed be seen to be ~50%: https://etherscan.io/blocks?ps=100&p=1

author: chris2_2_2
content: Thanks for clarifying, don't want to see screams of their attacking the network! if we decide to set something different

author: potuz
content: Is that "up to 30mm" correct? I thought there was no upper bound and miners were able to target higher than 30mm if they wanted

author: gwintery
content:
I am pretty sure you can target more than 30mm, the drama with EGL is what prompted the recent EIP to hardcode the gas limit to 30mm.

30mm is what was deemed "safe" by some client devs, while there are also some who diasgree with this.
